titles.title: Raw high-frequency EK80 echosounder datasets from autonomous sailbuoy campaign in Lofoten/Vesterålen 2018

descriptions.description:
In 2018, the autonomous surface vehicle sailbuoy [Echo]() surveyed the coastal shelf area surrounding the Lofoten and Vesterålen islands, Norway. The Echo is equipped with a
[EK80](https://www.kongsberg.com/maritime/products/ocean-science/ocean-science/es_scientific/transducers-for-scientific-echo-sounders/simrad-wbt-mini)
– a high-frequency echosounder built for scientific purposes. The sailbuoy campaign was part of the research project
[Unmanned ocean vehicles, a flexible and cost-efficient offshore monitoring and data management approach](https://prosjektbanken.forskningsradet.no/en/project/FORISS/269188). In 2022, Akvaplan-niva is releasing the complete echosounder data from Sailbuoy Echo's 2018 campaign their [Zenodo](https://zenodo.org/communities/akvaplan-niva/search?page=1&size=20&q=sailbuoy%20ek80%202018) archive. The data cover 131 field days and consists of 8791 `.raw` files with a combined size of 750 GB. Datasets 2018-03-08/2018-03-12 2018-03-13/2018-03-17 2018-03-18/2018-04-01 2018-04-02/2018-04-05 2018-04-06/2018-04-26 2018-04-27/2018-05-03 2018-05-04/2018-05-30 2018-05-31/2018-06-02 2018-06-03/2018-06-06 2018-06-07/2018-06-09 2018-06-10/2018-06-12 2018-06-13/2018-06-17 2018-06-18/2018-06-30 2018-07-01/2018-07-11 2018-07-12/2018-07-17 2018-07-18/2018-07-28 2018-07-29/2018-08-22
